alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 3:12AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following county, Blaine. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated continuing rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Turner and Hogeland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
